item.title: Systemd Nspawn Raspbian
item.description: use systemd-nspawn to boot raspbian image The setup is a bit tricky and some things might have to be changed, but it should basically work. setup the loopback devive using: loosetup -f -P <path_to_img>.img as root and lets assume the output is /dev/loop1. make sure you have the prerequistes: qemu-user-static binfmt-support run sudo update-binfmts --enable qemu-arm or something similar create a mount point, lets assume mnt in the current directory mount the image mount /dev/loop1p1 mnt try to start a chroot using systemd-nspawn --bind /lib64 --bind /usr/bin/qemu-arm-static -D mnt /bin/bash as root.
